The main cause of delay is late and uncorrect diaGnosis. This fact is ve ry important especially today because with promptly instituted, tuberculostatic ther- apy the anatomic and functional results are better. S/08i/62/000/011/018/037 E075/El36 AUTHORS: Litomisky, Jaromi'r,.and Svoboda, Jir'i TITLE: Quantitative determina-tion of monazite.and zircon in Otava sands by spectrozhemical methods PERIODICAL: Reforativnyy zhurnal, Khimiya, no.11, 1962, 149, abstract 11 D143- (In the Collection: listr'ed. ~istavu gool, Odd. geol., v.26, 1959 (1961), 87-118Y. (Czech, abstracts in English and Russian). TEXT: A spectrochemical method -was developed for the determination of monazite and zircon in the sands and,alluvial deposits on the basis of determin.,.*Lng the bond between Ce, La and Zr, and certain minerals. Results are given of optical, X-ray and qualitatï¿½ve spectral investigatioas of sand concentrates from the'. river Otava (more than 140 samples) and also calibration graphs for the determination of Ce, La and Zr contents. Detailed description is given of the sample preparation for analysis, preparation of standard solutions with the concentration range of 5-0-0005%, conditions for the recording and analysis of thia spectra. No. PV 32oo.-64 SOURCE: Vynalevj, no. 10, 1965, 19 TOPIC TAGS: ultrasonic flaw detector, flaw detection ABE-TRACT: A method is described for the automatic recording of defects in materials. The defects are detected by an ultra-sound device distinguished by the feature that the. defects in tle material detected by the ultrasonic probe of a detectoscope act upcn the recorder, M-iich traces a topographic record in rectangalar coordinates. The reflected ultrasound is corrierted to electrical pulses in such a way that the mcn-ement of the recorder is disturbed or interrupted and synchronized with the forward movement of the conveyev in one direction. At the same time the movement of the recording dram is mechanically synchronized with the reverse movement of the carrier in the reverse direction which is perpendiculw to the first movement.
